intro: Tecoma evenia, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces elongated, woody pods that contain seeds. Tecoma evenia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blossoms and adaptability to various soil types. It thrives in full sun and is drought-tolerant once established.
